channel.title: Windows 7
channel.description: Window 7 wont let me compile or run server says cant find javaw

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @_Charlie `Charlie_
item.description:
@_Charlie wrote:

R_u_skeptical:

Window 7 wont let me compile or run server says cant find javaw

sonicforce41:

javaw? edit run.bat and just leave it as “java” not “javaw”

Are you both dumb?

Java runs your project.
Javaw also runs your project (if I remember correctly hides the cmd box).
Javac compiles your project.

If what deathschaos9 said doesn’t work, right click on your batch file and go to edit, remove everything and paste

@ECHO OFF @TITLE Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java

jdk1.6.0_16 is your Java folder, change it if it isn’t version 16, and if you have it in Program Files (x86) then follow the last bit of what deathschaos9 said.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:328371”]Go into your environmental variables and make two new user variables.

Right click My Computer, click properties, click advanced system settings, click advanced(if needed), click environmental variables.

Name:CLASSPATH
Value:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

And

Name:PATH
Value:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;

If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version, most likely 17 or 18.[/quote]

Search next time.

Read full topic
